Docs.summary: Contains event data for the event and the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When an <xref:System.AppDomain> instance is shut down or unloaded, an <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.AppDomainShutdown> event or an <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.AppDomainUnloaded> event is raised, respectively. The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildManagerHostUnloadEventArgs> object stores the reason for the shutdown or unload and is passed to the event handler as one of its parameters.

Docs.summary: Gets the reason the hosted application domain was shut down.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildManagerHostUnloadEventArgs.Reason%2A> property stores an <xref:System.Web.ApplicationShutdownReason> object as its value that describes why the <xref:System.AppDomain> instance was shut down.
